meanings.definition: The state or quality of being stale.
meanings.sent1: The staleness of the bread made it hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: I could smell the staleness of the room as soon as I entered.
meanings.sent3: The staleness of the joke made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The staleness of the air in the attic felt suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The staleness of the news left everyone feeling bored and uninspired.

meanings.definition: The condition of being unoriginal or lacking in freshness.
meanings.sent1: The staleness of the ideas presented in the meeting was evident.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with the staleness of cliches.
meanings.sent3: The staleness of the movie plot made it predictable.
meanings.sent4: The staleness of the music industry needs a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The staleness of the fashion trends made her crave something new.
